thread.title: Brock Hekking, San Diego Chargers defensive end, eats 21,000 calories | video
thread.title_full: Brock Hekking, San Diego Chargers defensive end, eats 21,000 calories | video

author: Tyson Otto
title: Brock Hekking, San Diego Chargers defensive end, eats 21,000 calories | video
text:
Video Image Hard Count: Hayne almost scores & game winners galore 4:46 NFL: The team from Hard Count break down all the action from week five, looking at Jarryd Hayne almost scoring, thrilling finishes, big hits, St. Louis end an Aaron Rodgers streak, and Laurie reports from the Giants v 49ers game.
October 13th 2015 7 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/More Sports/ It’s difficult to be unimpressed by Brock Hekking.
Tyson Otto news.com.au WHEN Michael Phelps revealed his daily diet intake of 12,000 calories ahead of the 2008 Beijing Olympics the world was shocked.
It was the diet where the American Olympic swimming champion would eat 4,000 calories each time he sat down for a meal. Pasta, egg sandwiches and pancakes everywhere.
Earlier this year, America was just as stunned when Houston Texans NFL star J.J. Watt revealed he forces himself to consume between 6,000 and 9,000 calories a day just to keep at his 131kg frame.
Well, now it’s time to meet San Diego Chargers defensive linebacker Brock Hekking.
The 24-year-old has not been idle since getting injured and being placed on the Chargers’ inactive roster.
He recently needed to have two screws surgically implanted into his left foot. Fortunately, his stomach works just fine.
The 1.90m, 113kg unit put himself to the ultimate test to see how much damage he could cause at the San Diego barbecue restaurant.
The answer is total destruction.
Brock Hekking eats barbecue Here’s what was on the menu, according to Bleacher Report .
2 racks of beef ribs
2 racks of baby back ribs
1 whole chicken
2 pulled pork sandwiches
1 giant sausage
1 pound of mac and cheese
Large side of fries
Large onion rings
Bite of coleslaw
2 ears of corn
1.9 litre Mountain Dew
That’s more than 21,396 calories.
He did it in less than 42mins 38secs.
That’s a rate of 501.5 calories per minute.
It’s even better from the side.
It’s not the first time Hekking has been an internet sensation.
In the weeks leading into the 2015 NFL Draft, it was his unique blond locks that made headlines.
The Vacaville High School student became a college football star at the University of Nevada where he reportedly moved around the campus in a camouflaged golf buggy and was so popular the school handed out mullet wigs to fans at games.
His so-called “golden waterfall of mullet” also got the attention of TMZ Sports earlier this week.
Just as confronting as his hair is the fact that Hekking has actually dropped quite a few kilos recently.
After playing his college football at 120kg, he has dropped 7kg since joining the Chargers.
Hekking has signed a three-year deal with San Diego, but can be cut at any time as a free agent rookie.
